function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Proliferation of misinformation and fake news on social media platforms during pandemics","Impact":"Can lead to confusion, panic, and dissemination of incorrect information, undermining public health efforts","Mitigation":"Implement fact-checking mechanisms, educate the public on identifying trustworthy sources, and collaborate with social media platforms to curb misinformation","Technologies":"AI algorithms for content moderation, data analysis tools for identifying misinformation trends","People":"General public, policymakers, healthcare professionals","Owner":"Social media platforms, government agencies, healthcare organizations"},{"Description":"Weak collaboration among relevant stakeholders in disseminating evidence during pandemics","Impact":"Can result in fragmented communication, conflicting messages, and ineffective dissemination of critical information","Mitigation":"Establish cross-sector communication protocols, foster partnerships, and create centralized platforms for knowledge sharing","Technologies":"Collaborative tools for virtual meetings, project management platforms for shared information","People":"Policymakers, healthcare professionals, non-governmental organizations","Owner":"KT platforms, government agencies, non-governmental organizations"},{"Description":"Scarcity of relevant research and actionable evidence during pandemics","Impact":"Limits the availability of reliable data for decision-making, leading to uncertainty and potentially ineffective responses","Mitigation":"Invest in research infrastructure, promote data-sharing initiatives, and support rapid evidence generation and dissemination","Technologies":"Data sharing platforms, research collaboration tools, rapid response research funding mechanisms","People":"Researchers, policymakers, healthcare professionals","Owner":"Government agencies, research institutions, funding bodies"}]}
